ECDsa Class

In this Article

Provides an abstract base class that encapsulates the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class ECDsa : System.Security.Cryptography.AsymmetricAlgorithm

Constructors

  • ECDsa()

    Initializes a new instance of the ECDsa class.

    protected ECDsa ();

    Remarks

    This constructor is called by classes that derive from the ECDsa class. The ECDsaCng class is the only implementation currently supported by the .NET Framework. You may provide your own custom implementation.

Properties

  • KeyExchangeAlgorithm

    Gets the name of the key exchange algorithm.

    public override string KeyExchangeAlgorithm { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      Always null.

    Remarks

    This property is inherited from the AsymmetricAlgorithm base class.

    The Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) is used for digital signature generation; it is not used for key derivation Therefore, this property returns null.

  • SignatureAlgorithm

    Gets the name of the signature algorithm.

    public override string SignatureAlgorithm { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The string "ECDsa".

Methods

  • Create()

    Creates a new instance of the default implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

    public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create ();

    Returns

    • ECDsa

      A new instance of the default implementation (ECDsaCng) of this class.

  • Create(String)

    Creates a new instance of the specified implementation of the Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA).

    public static System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsa Create (string algorithm);

    Parameters

    • algorithm
      String

      The name of an ECDSA implementation. The following strings all refer to the same implementation, which is the only implementation currently supported in the .NET Framework:

      - "ECDsa"

      - "ECDsaCng"

      - "System.Security.Cryptography.ECDsaCng"

      You can also provide the name of a custom ECDSA implementation.

    Returns

    • ECDsa

      A new instance of the specified implementation of this class. If the specified algorithm name does not map to an ECDSA implementation, this method returns null.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      The algorithm parameter is null.

    Remarks

    If you develop your own implementation of an ECDsa object, you can use the Create method overload to create a custom algorithm string that specifies your implementation.

    If you specify a custom value for the algorithm parameter, the CryptoConfig object will use it to determine whether an ECDSA object can be created.

      -or-

      offset + count â€“ 1 results in an index that is beyond the upper bound of data.

  • VerifyHash(Byte[],Byte[])

    Verifies a digital signature against the specified hash value.

    public abstract bool VerifyHash (byte[] hash, byte[] signature);

    Parameters

    • hash
      Byte[]

      The hash value of a block of data.

    • signature
      Byte[]

      The digital signature to be verified.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the hash value equals the decrypted signature; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The signature is first decrypted by using the public key, and then compared to the hash value for verification.
